content.description: Start as for the False, matched on the obvious blocky hold.  Climb up the face, gaining the right arete and topping out at the apex of the Boulder.  An intricate, proud, and striking line.
content.protection: 5 pads minimum and a spotter wouldn't hurt.
content.location: Park at south shore beach.  Cross the train tracks as if your going to the balanced rock trail.  Hang a right on the grottos trail and walk along the base of the talus.  After a hundred yards look up and left and the crown-like Boulder is easily visible a 100 yards up in the talus.  All in all 10 minutes or so from the car.  True Lies faces downhill and you probably will see chalk from the trail.

content.description: Start low in crack and get to jug. From there work your way up edges and slopers.
content.location: East side of Block Party Boulder.  Just right of Block Corner.

content.description: Start low on good holds and work your way up jugs.
content.location: Front of Block Party Boulder facing down to trail.

content.description: From a stand, matched on a left facing block hold, pull on with difficulty and climb up through slopey pinch holds to a juggy hold.  From there move left to top out.
content.protection: 4 pads or more and a good spot
content.location: On the Block Party Boulder.  To get there park at the south shore beach as you were going to hike the Balanced Rock Trail.  From the parking, cross the train tracks, then stay right on the grottos trail and walk along the base of the talus and hillside.  After a few hundred the trail will be right next to the talus field and a big boulder with a nice looking downhill face will be seen above.  That is the boulder, and The False climbs the pretty face.     Approach time: 5-10 min.

content.description: Hard!  Climb steep face starting with opposing gastons.  Make hard move to triangle pinch and get to arÃªte.  Top-out.
content.location: Main face of boulder.  From Balance Rock Trail junction hike Grottos Trail for about 200ft.  Stay close to talus and keep looking for steep boulder facing down hill.

content.description: Start low with good under-clings, work the feet and dead-point to lip.  Heady top-out.
content.location: About 100ft up from Grottos Trail.  East corner of Block Party Boulder.

content.description: Large block in the middle of the boulder field.
